Reviews.Title: “Sleeping beauty waiting to be kissed...”
Reviews.Author: EleganTrips
Reviews.Content: Good location, excellent infrastructure with busses 14, 414, 211 right outside and two minutes to Fulham Broadway tube. Friendly and helpful service, good breakfast. This hotel just screams for a makeover like double glazed windows, modern bathrooms, good beds and interior decoration for the bedrooms. Other than that very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: daronim
Reviews.Content: I did stay at La Reserve a couple of weeks ago with my girlfriend, and we had a wonderful time over there. The room that we stayed in was very quiet and clean, apart from that the location was very good very close to centre of London and sights seeing. However If you dont expect a modern hotel probably you will have a great time over there like us.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty and run down”
Reviews.Author: lornak2011
Reviews.Content: On arrival glass on main entrance was flithy and once checked in discovered our room to be smelly with tatty bed linen, one electricial socket to be working and a broken window. we were then moved to a bigger room but with similiar standards again one plug socket working no spoon to stir tea, cups were flithy and the general look was shabby,Breakfast consisted of stale crossiants and the whole look of the hotel is very very run down, In need of a MAJOR refurb...so we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Run away!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Stinks, Dirty, grubby, smelly, unfriendly, unprofessional, rude. Never again!!!! .

Reviews.Title: “Highly Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: Tjome
Reviews.Content: This hotel would appear to be staffed by a bunch of complete incompetents. Having called to request a room rate for 12 rooms for 2 nights, I was initially quoted one price. When I called back to confirm the booking, I was told it would be £8 pounds per room per night more than the rate that I had been quoted. Never the less, I decided to go ahead and book the room, sending them an email with my credit card details and reference. Days went by whilst I awaited a response. Eventually I called into the hotel where I was informed that my email had not been received. I therefore went straight home and resent to the exact same address, only to receive a response saying that they only had 10 rooms available and that the price had miraculously gone up again by another £10 per room per night. In hindsight, and having seen inside the lobby, I suppose it’s not such a bad thing. The room looked like I had just stepped into 1992 and there was a strange stale smell. I cannot recommend highly enough that you avoid this place. You would be better off taking your chances on a park bench!

Reviews.Title: “Lumpy Beds and Dated ,Tatty furniture”
Reviews.Author: RedTinkerbell
Reviews.Content: The welcoming clean foyer of this hotel belies the appalling state of the rooms. The walls and doors along the corridors are grubby and desperate need of painting . The rooms themselves were not very clean and the beds were atrocious, I have never known a lumpier more uncomfortable bed and the alleged 'spacious bathrooms' as per their leaflet are tiny. There were long dark hairs clogging up the plug hole. Three redeeming features are 1. It's close to Fulham Broadway station ( District Line) 2. I was given a complimentary basket of surprisingly fresh fruit in the room. 3. Breakfast was above standard with plenty of choice and the staff allowed us to check in early and look after our luggage after we had checked out. However, I shall not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly utterly filthy, disgusting, dirty & apparently bug ridden hell hole”
Reviews.Author: nick s
Reviews.Content: This is what the hotel's own website says: All rooms are well equipped with the latest facilities including air-conditioning (selected rooms), High Speed Wireless Internet access, Mini-bar, Direct Dial Telephone and Colour Satellite TV, plus much more. The reality? Rooms are filthy. Dirty floors. Dirty carpets and furniture that was tatty beyond belief. The shower was a trickle that left running would have taken a year to fill the dirty bath. The 'double' bed was two large singles pushed together with a large double mattress on top. There are various reports of bed bugs on other reviews but fortunately I didn't experience this. 'Air conditioning' was a clapped out portable AC unit that didn't work. Wifi wasn't included, despite the description giving the impression it was. 'Mini Bar' was a fridge that contained a couple of cans of coke. The fridge didn't work. 'Satellite TV' was a 10 year old TV that had five analogue channels (not even Free View!) that were unwatchable because the TV wasn't tuned properly. 'Plus more' ??? This was a 'superior' room as well by the way. If I'd had one with me, I would have pitched a tent in the middle of the Fulham Road road rather than sleep in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Fulhamfamily
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel and the rooms are far from perfect - but a great location and very cheap

Reviews.Title: “Bad”
Reviews.Author: kond-nikolaj
Reviews.Content: Making the tracking on the island of Praslin in November 2010, I was hungry and saw a pointer to a restaurant of this hotel. I went in search of this restaurant. But the hotel manager drove me, despite my hunger. I propose to dismiss this control. It's bad, does not correspond to his post. He behaved rudely and somodovolno. Traveling the world, the first time I saw

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Alex2512
Reviews.Content: Having been to this place twice in two totally different rooms I am still only half pleased. The room is okay as I only needed it to sleep in, the bathroom needs a lot of work as the shower is more like a tap as it doesn't have the power to actually be called a shower. The food is ok if you just want a snack but go else where for a proper meal. The staff who friendly and spoke in a polite manner. Only use this hotel if you just want the basics and nothing else

Reviews.Title: “No curtains”
Reviews.Author: summerMonaco
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is well located and yes, it is noisy (even a room at the back) because of the planes. But also, there are only very transparent white curtains so the light comes in really early. Otherwise, it's clean and the bed is great. Dreadful breakfast. Only stay here if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you hate yourself!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaGordon6969
Reviews.Content: I wish I had checked Trip Advisor before booking here. After my horrific stay here I emailed a complaint to both the hotel & the company who own it & didnt get any response. Not sure why this surprised me; it just proves this company are rude & incompetent throughout all its work force. On arrival, we took the last space in the carpark. A staff member, the night porter, rushed out & rudely asked us what we thought we were doing. We assured him we were guests about to check in. He asked us to check in BEFORE we parked. Bizarre. 2) When we said we needed to finish parking before coming in, the night porter suspiciously watched us through the glass door, yet as we approached the door, struggling with luggage in both hands, he walked away, leaving us to put down our bags to open the door. Rude. 3)When we got to our room, the phone was ringing. The night porter asked us to come back to reception immediately to hand in our car keys. After talking to him & the night manager, they were unable to supply us with any proof of insurance incase any damage was done to our car while they were in possession of the keys. Illegal. 4) When we told them we therefore couldn't give them our car keys they sneeringly told us they would have to phone our room 'At 1am or 2am' if they needed us to move our car. When we said that was going to have to be fine, we were then told NO! We MUST move our car out onto the road. We asked if that would be safe, we were assured yes. We were told that we didn't need to put a parking ticket on til 9am. On checking the street signs it was actually 8am. So if we had listened to the staff, we would have got a parking fine. Uninformed. 5)At 7.30am we found our car had been vandalised. We managed to get it into the car park but were immediately told it would have to be moved as it was 'match day'. The hotel rents out its car park, stuff the guests! Staff were utterly uninterested in the vandalism. Unhelpful. 6) We spent the morning talking to garages & arranging for Autoglass to replace the windscreen. We asked the receptionist how long we could stay in the carpark to wait for the repair man. They said when we book out by midday, the car would need to be gone by midday. We told them it was undrivable, there was zero vision out of the shattered windscreen. They said we could stay until 5.30pm but would have to either book for another night or pay £15 for a space. Unsympathetic. The 1 night stay resulted in a very distressing 24 hrs. The response from the staff led to a wholly unacceptable customer service experience. On top of this room was hot, smelly & unclean. Very loud noises coming from all over the corridors & outside. Worst hotel experience of my life. JUST AWFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: xxkrolle
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Fine hotel. Close to the underground where it is possible to run directly to Westminster (Big Ben, London Eye. Etc) The hotel has a prime location for Stamford Bridge (50m), 200m to the underground and a few 100 meters up to one of the most expensive streets in London (King's Road) where many celebrities come and open the windows of their new Ferrari, Porsche or a second car that bmw, audi and land rover. The area around the hotel, many restaurants, cafes, shops etc.. The staff is very sweet. They offered me to book a taxi to the airport if I had not mastered it. Breakfast is not fantastic. But dinner is fine. The hotel is not a 5 star, but if you just have to sleep there and walk in shower is perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “Small, tired rooms but great location!”
Reviews.Author: ShezzaLancashire Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated next door to Chelsea Football club and we arrived at 2pm on a match day so the area was extremely busy as you would imagine! There were security staff on the front door of the hotel but we didn't see them again, so presumably that is just a match day precaution. Check-in was easy but I remember thinking the lounge looked shoddy, there was a stained settee in reception on our arrival, but that had gone some time later so probably was there awaiting removal. Our room was situated on the ground floor, just through from reception. It was small, and the furnishings were very shoddy and in need of up-grading. Rather disappointing compared to the web-site pictures. Beds were comfortable though and breakfast was nice, with a menu that would satisfy most people - continental and full English was available along with a vegetarian option. ( Vegetarian burger, not sausage - different!! ) We were going to Earl's Court and the hotel was close to Fulham Broadway tube station so was very convenient for travel. Our stay was for a weekend. Staff were pleasant enough and the hotel itself was adequate. I would stay there again, but would ensure I had looked at other choices in the vicinity first!

Reviews.Title: “RIDDLED WITH BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: bedbugresearcher
Reviews.Content: They are rampant. Please don't stay here. They refuse to rectify the problem and the beds are so full of bugs, we had over 100 bites. And there is then the risk of bringing them home. The manager is fully aware of the issue but refuses to rid of the mattresses. Please pass this along!

Reviews.Title: “Worse every time”
Reviews.Author: osmachar
Reviews.Content: In the past 10 years I have stayed at this hotel 3 times. The first time then hotel was a pleasant 3 star with friendly staff, satellite TV and ok decor. The second time the staff was less friendly, no more sat tv and a reduced breakfast quality, but the redeeming feature was the free parking and it was generally an ok place. Then I stayed there again last month - mainly because I needed the parking space - and it was BAD. We arrived on a day with a power cut and the staff saw us as an inconvenience and was generally quite unfriendly and could barely understand English. Our room wasn't hoovered due to the powercut and when asking if this would be done as soon as the power is back, we were told 'no tomorrow'. The room wasn't actually too bad and had been cleaned. The room ws small-ish with very worn furniture, but the linen was clean and the matrass looked ok to the eye too. The curtains and bed spread should have been washed a long time ago though. The TV was hardly watchable due to very bad reception. The bathroom tiles were cracked but all appeared cleaned. The first morning the breakfast was ok and rolls & croissants seemed fresh. The sencod morning the rolls & croissants tasted to be from the previous week. When checking out I complained as they were charging full price for an unhoovered room and the bad breakfast but the receptionist was very rude and made it sound as if it had been our fault. i woulnd't have minded all the negatives so much if the price had been beetter - we pais £85 per night for the room and the service and standart did absolutely not match the price.

Reviews.Title: “Crap hotel gave us BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: DrNugu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July and my wife got bitten all over by bed bugs. These rooms are NOT CLEAN. I found a couple of them and the linen full of blood. Friggin' things wouldn't even die when I popped them! So disgusting I was checking every bed in every hotel afterwards. Then the manager/owner tried to imply that we might have brought them! This was the first leg of our trip and we had just stepped off of business class...I don't think so. Wanted to wring his neck...but he didn't actually come out and say it. The breakfast was crap. Standard cereal and bread but everything a bit stale.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back again”
Reviews.Author: 113guinness
Reviews.Content: I will not be returning to this hotel. We paid £89.00 per twin room which i would value at about £40. The car park is small with no bays so we had to park where we could and leave the keys for all 4 of our vehicles behind reception in case they needed to be moved. The beds were uncomfortable with springs sticking into you while sleeping, the pillows were lumpy and the linen didn't look the freshest. The showers have been set at Umpa Lumpa height so you bang your head on them and the room decor really needs attention. My worst complaint would be the staff when they could be found. They were very abrubt and rude,due to this we ate and drank elsewhere which resulted in them losing around £300 as thats what we spent in another venue. The breakfast was of continental style but you had to ask for toast and walk around the restaurant to look for sugar.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother! I'd rather stay in a hostel!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel119
Reviews.Content: Hostel quality for hotel prices. Only stay here if you're a heavy sleeper and not too fussed about comfort. Or if you're here for the football. Room was an ok size, bed linen clean, but the room in general wasn't comfortable. This is good if you're going to come back to the room late (preferably drunk therefore not fussed about comfort) only to use the bed for a few hours sleep. I am a heavy sleeper and I'll happily sleep through traffic noises, talking, car alarms, etc, however I was violently awoken by slamming doors pretty much every hour. There is free parking, but there are no marked bays so you literally park your in whatever way fits even if cars are blocked in. We didn't feel safe with the car there so parked it on a single yellow line on Fulham Road instead. Single yellows are good at 6pm-8am, and all day Sundays. The TV didn't work, the hairdryer would work for 2 minutes and then switch itself off, no air conditioning so this is a problem in the summer heat and humidity. There was an old fan that luckily did work! The bathroom was generally clean. Everything was old though, and many tiles were chipped or cracked. There was no hand soap. There were however two pump-action bottles (body wash and shampoo) that were refilled many times before us. One of the pumps were broken so had to unscrew the lid and pour the body wash out to use. If you really must stay here, bring your own soap/hand wash, toothpaste and toothbrush, and very importantly: ear plugs. Customer service wasn't great. Had to wait 10 minutes at the empty reception desk before a member of staff showed up. Needed to speak to a member of staff on two occasions but nobody could be found at the reception desk. I'm trying to think of good things to say about this hotel, so I will finish off with the following: Complimentary basket of fruit, and tea-making facilities. Bed and bath linen is clean even if the room isn't. 5 minute walk from Fulham Broadway tube station, a good number of restaurants and bars nearby, accessible to/from central London for museums shopping etc. Sainsburys, Boots and a few other shops are located in the tube station shopping centre. Less than 10 min walk to a lovely Thai restaurant called Blue Elephant. Ask for a seat by the 'lake/pond'. Situated next to Chelsea football stadium, so this is good if you're here for the football.

Reviews.Title: “surprise surprise”
Reviews.Author: monkey57
Reviews.Content: my friend booked this hotel for 4 of us, after reading the reviews i was not looking forward to it,but i was pleasantly surprised,yes i agree the hotel is very dated and in need of decorating but the room was clean. the continental breakfast was excellent and the staff i spoke too very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too hot. Quilt cover Had a patch...”
Reviews.Author: Tullier
Reviews.Content: Rooms too hot. Quilt cover Had a patch. Ants in lobby by plants in case owner read this staff extremely unhelpful, cold , just not nice un interested. Had a conversation with one of them from round a corner didn't even bodder coming out of back office. Someone please tell the owner has the potential to be a great hotel. Just clean it and get some nice staff or a good manager

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MrsMurphy83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Reserve last week end,had already booked when I looked on 'Tripadvisor' I read all the bad reviews,but thought I would take the chance, as most other hotels were booked out. Big mistake, we checked in on the Thursday evening, after a very slow check in,the key to my room could not be found,so the porter had to use the master key to let me into my room,the room was clean enough,but had a very strong smell of cigars, I closed the curtains but they would did not cover the window, as the room was at the front of hotel it was very noisy.plus at ground level people could see in. I went to meet my colleagues, and while I was sitting in the reception/TV area I sat counting all the ants that were coming and going in and out of the floor boards. Breakfast was a very dull afair, I went to make tea and the water was cold from the machine.The staff looked fed up and were in no way helpful. Who I thought was the manager never spoke or was in anyway pleasant. All in all it was a terrible place to stay. Never again! next time I will check Tripadvisor before I book.

Reviews.Title: “Service is horrendous!!”
Reviews.Author: peanutob
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and I have to say the service is absolutely terrible. Staff don't want to help you at all and are extremely incompentant and rude! Food was terrible. Waited 20 mins for beans on toast one morning when were the only table there. Friend had her wedding there during our trip and they started to clear the place for breakfast the next morning at 10 that night and started popping her balloons! No staff at the bar during the wedding. No reception on our tiny tv! Great location but not really worth it! Faulty towers has nothing on this place!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jamcc21
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel. It looks okay on the website but it's a different story inside. We booked it for a 5 night stay and on arrival the room we were given was an absolute disgrace, the door didn't close properly, the bathroom was filthy, the "double bed" was two twins pushed together which didnn't stay in place. When we complained we had to wait until the next day to be moved to a slightly cleaner bigger room, but not much of an improvement. The food was not good at all and the staff were very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “If you value hygiene, DO NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaB090
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel with 6 colleagues and we ALL promptly checked back out again. This was despite losing the payment we had to make up front before being given our rooms. The first room I was given stank of smoke, the furnishings were worn and filthy and the windows were smeared with grime. You definitely wouldn't have walked bare foot on the carpet and when I pulled back the bed cover there were hairs in the sheets! The second room I was moved to, was exactly the same but unfortunately without the stale smell of smoke to disguise the stale smell of dirt! That said the corridor was thick with cigarette smoke. If you value your safety and hygiene, please do not book this hotel, no matter how attractive the price may seem for London.

Reviews.Title: “manky, manky, manky”
Reviews.Author: stickybeaks Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: If your idea of an OK hotel room is a damp, smelly, hole in the basement, which is opposite the fire door and next to the propped open door of a rather sinister looking cellar in the middle of some building works, which is therefore freezing, with decor dating from circa 1980, dubious stains on the indeterminate coloured carpet (tiles), a bath which doesn't drain, an uncleaned toilet and loud, drunken Russians arguing in the corridor for a large proportion of the evening, this is the place for you. Wish I hadn't been in such a panic to book somewhere at the last minute and read the reviews on Trip Advisor before I booked. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel - good location but several negatives in terms of facilities”
Reviews.Author: allieba13
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel late at night, and like a few other people have mentioned in their reviews, the receptionist couldn't find my booking, so I didn't get off to a great start. Thankfully I had e-mail confirmation of my booking with me. The room was ok. It did appear to have undergone a bit of a refurbishment - the dirty carpet other reviewers talked about had been replaced with a (poorly fitted) laminate floor, which did seem cleaner. Decor wise, the room was modern, although the curtains didn't close properly. The furniture however was still very old, of poor quality and chipped. Many of the bathroom tiles were also cracked. There were items left by a previous guest in one of the drawers, and although the room didn't seem unclean, this still made me question the thoroughness of the cleaners. My main bugbear was that when you opened one of the built in wardrobes, there were many electrical wires and loose fittings hanging down - I can't imagine this meets UK safety standards for accommodation! There is one major positive with the hotel though - it is only a few minutes walk from Fulham Broadway tube station. Also, although the rooms aren't the best, the hotel does have a nice reception area with cosy sofas / newspapers / magazines etc.

Reviews.Title: “Itching to leave...”
Reviews.Author: Meltwarrior
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at Stamford Bridge (Chelsea FC's ground). This was less than a one minute walk away. That was the good news. On the downside...when I checked in they had no record of payment (room had been paid for in advance). Fortunately I had documentation proving they were wrong. In terms of the room, it was huge, but run down. Toilet hadn't been flushed by the cleaners. Small TV, only 5 analogue channels. When I woke the next morning, I noticed I was itching a lot...yes, bed bugs. And lots of them. Nice. Breakfast was pretty poor. Cooked option was extra, so included in the B&B rate was cereal, bread rolls (no toaster that I could see) and cheese slices.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, comfortable, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LittleSugarplumfairy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in La Reserve in Fulham a couple of times this summer having discovered a good discounted rate online. It is within 5/10 mins walk from Fulham Broadway tube station (which has a good Sainsburys to stock up on snacks/drinks) on the District Line so very handy to get to South Kensington (museums), Harrods, and if going to Wimbledon, is just a couple of stops north of Southfields. The first time I stayed in June I was at the front of the building which fronts the Fulham Road. This was a bit noisy so I had to close my windows and keep on the air con (the curtains also needed to stay over as everyone would be able to see in, although the curtains pulled over with difficulty!). The bed was comfortable, the tv small and up on the wall at a great height. The hairdryer blew a fuse the first time I used it, but reception had it fixed within the day. The bathroom was small but clean with a large shower. Breakfast was continental and had a sufficient selection of cereals, croissants, tea/coffee to suit (more than the Ibis offer). Full breakfast was extra although I didn't see anyone eating one. The staff were friendly and helpful (I left behind a pair of earrings which they kept for me and handed to me immediately I arrived for my second visit in August). The second time I stayed there I went with my son. I had requested a room at the back (which faces the back of Chelsea's Stamford Bridge football ground, so not a great view but we didn't mind) so it was quieter and we could leave our windows open. We didn't have air con this time so had to leave the fan in the room on constantly otherwise we'd have been dripping in sweat in the London heat. The fridge didn't work (although we didn't use it), the bathroom was larger, had a bath and a shower over it this time and the room was much bigger than my previous one. While it was clean and functional and value for money, it just lacked a little finesse which a more expensive hotel would probably have offered (and a good lick of paint). Basic but clean. The thing that really got us though the second time round was the attitude of one of the serving staff at breakfast. Having had an early start the previous morning, we lay in until 9.45 am and headed down for breakfast at 10.15, as breakfast was due to finish at 10.30 according to their literature. While there were other diners still eating breakfast, we were approached by one particular member of staff to tell us in no uncertain terms we were too late for breakfast, that it had finished at 10 am. I told her that it said 10.30 on their information in the room (it even said it on the card on the tables), she just seemed to ignore me and insisted that it finished at 10 am during the summer (having been there a few weeks previously I was not aware that this was the case). She "allowed" us to have something to eat, as long as we didn't take long. A similar thing happened on the last day of our 5 day stay, when we arrived down to breakfast at 9.40 am. She came over to tell us that as breakfast was finishing soon, we should hurry up. This certainly didn't make me feel very comfortable or particularly welcome. Was she in a hurry to get finished?? Aside from that the other staff were very friendly and they gave me a suitcase bag when I was checking out for coming back a second time which was a very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: campfiremagic
Reviews.Content: had to catch an early flight. two rooms asked for wake up calls, no one called. asked for a cab knowing how to get to stanstead bus stop at victoria station - we were dropped on the street and told to walk around we would find it. could have easily missed our flights. hotel in poor condition, tv did not work, bath drain did not work, taps dripped etc.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is dirty.”
Reviews.Author: Luscious2009
Reviews.Content: When I approached La Reserve from the street I was very pleased with what I saw, but don't be duped by the plush exterior as this is massively deceiving: When I tried to check in, I was told that the hotel was full and my booking had been cancelled due to an issue with the payment card, but sensing somehow this was unacceptable the manager found me a room which evidently belonged to someone else judging by the "welcome note" and disgusting-looking bowl of fruit. My room was in the basement, and the first thing that hit me when I stepped into the corridor was the smell of thick cigarette smoke, despite the huge "NO SMOKING" sign on the wall. My room was unclean-feeling with strange burns all over the dirty carpet, and all the furniture was battered and falling apart - the glass wardrobe door was cracked and cellotaped together, and I couldn't get a single channel on the old 1980s television. The curtains were dirty, and the duvet in the cupboard looked as though it hadn't been washed for a long time. After finding a brown-stained towel hanging in the bathroom, I asked to be moved rooms as the smell of smoke was making my eyes sting. The following day I was moved to an upstairs room. Again the furniture was very old and worn out, windows dirty, and curtains which didn't meet in the middle. Again the room had a very un-clean feel about it, with a selection of 4 duvets in the cupboard - each badly stained with various body fluid. The television had no remote control, and the hairdryer worked for about 5 seconds before smoking and conking out. I wore shoes throughout my stay as I couldn't face walking bare-foot on the carpet or bathroom floor. Breakfast consisted of yesterday's stale criossants and bowls of tinned fruit (peach slices in syrup, pear halves in syrup). The orange juice had a funny taste and I had no idea how to make a cup of tea so I didn't bother with breakfast for the rest of my 4 day stay. The bar was unwelcoming and always devoid of people, despite the hotel being full. The only good thing going for this hotel is the location - perfectly positioned for Earl's Court via Fulham Broadway tube station, but it really isn't worth staying here. This hotel is dirty, shoddy, generally unclean-feeling wherever you go, and the service is poor. An absolute rip-off!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: railfan79
Reviews.Content: I have just had two nights in this hotel and cannot understand the very derogatory and negative reviews posted quite recently by others. I was one of a party involved in a show at Earls Court and a total of 9 persons occupied 8 different rooms over 3 nights and not a single one had any complaints at all about the standard of the rooms and hotel facilities. My own room was of quite a reasonable size with a double bed (it may have been 2 singles joined together but if so it was not noticeable) with a good sized bathroom. Both were spotlessly clean and the bed linen was crisp and clean. The bedroom furniture was perhaps a little dated but nevertheless perfectly acceptable. The hotel is well situated on the Fulham Broadway road just a short walk from the underground station so quite convenient for travel into central areas for shopping and shows etc. Breakfast included in the price was an acceptable Continental variety with plenty of cereals and fresh fruits plus bread rolls and croisettes etc and a cooked English breakfast was available at a small extra charge. The hotel may not be up to a 4 or 5 star standard like the Ritz or Dorchester but then neither is the cost and it is certainly a good 2 star rating. I can certainly recommend it as a good base for anyone visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Would be embarrassed to recommend”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: No chain to lock the door or spy hole. There was a knock at the door soon after arriving - as I was looking for the spy hole the door opened. It was a member of staff but still. Bathroom: taps, shower head, sink, plug holes unclean Bedroom: outdated, curtains would not close completely, tv remote would not work - not convinced that it was for the tv. Fridge was mouldy, walls and radiator dirty. I did not feel clean after being there for the night - rates good for food but from seeing the standard of the room I decided to use another restaurant for both dinner and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel in bourgeois area!!”
Reviews.Author: tina_derry
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on hotelsclick.com and got a really good deal for a double room for 2 nights. We were going to a football match at Stamford Bridge and the hotel is perfectly located, a couple of minutes walk from tube station. The room was small, but had a comfy bed and clean bathroom, decor a bit tired but we were out and about so it really wasn't a big deal. The staff were kind, and let us store our bags as our flight home wasn't until later in the day. Ticked all the boxes for a bargain hotel in the Chelsea area of London!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Bother Staying”
Reviews.Author: Asif786
Reviews.Content: Well, i looked at the website seemed good with on-site parking when i got there, 1st impresions were it okay the reception guy was bit moody, then got to the room it was a triple bed with 2 singles attached so asked to move they then moved us to another room again instead of double bed it was 2 singles attached togther when i told the reception guy he said thats how they are all double beds are like that was the worst person to have the converstaion with as he didnt want to admit that they need to update their place. Then all night we heard the noises from upstairs people walking up and down the Hotel, hotel rooms had floor boards come on. Dont stay there if you going for a romantic weekend. Would recomend: [-] its similar in price really wicked hotels i am dead serious its fantastic and cosy.

Reviews.Title: “london weekend”
Reviews.Author: S-Head
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay on the hotel website and received a substantial discount for booking online (we paid £75 for a double room and £75 for a twin room). This made the stay extremely good value for a hotel in a fantastic location in the lovely borough of Fulham just a couple of minutes walk from fulham broadway tube station and with a bus stop almost outside the hotel. Whats more, the hotel is one of very few in london that has a car park and allows guests to park for free (subject to space). This was a great bonus. The hotel itself looked nice from the outside and the reception, bar a and restaurant area all looked well kept. The rooms looked a little tired and could do with being updated but were a good size and were equipped with everything you could need. I read other reviews about terrible tv reception, but all i can say is that the terrestrial tv we viewed was fine in our room. The bathroom was again slightly dated but clean and functional. We ate the standard breakfast included in the room price and were pleasantly surprised at the broad selection of cereals, breads, pastries and fruit on offer which made a good start to the day. Overall, the hotel is dated and may not have been worth paying the full price but if you can book online it becomes very reasonably priced for its prime location and the parking facility.

Reviews.Title: “A trip back to the 80's...”
Reviews.Author: Grimble22
Reviews.Content: Firstly the good news: the location is good (assuming Chelsea don't have a home match, since the hotel backs onto Stamford Bridge stadium), having free off-road parking is great, and the staff are friendly and helpful. HOWEVER this hotel is best suited to the visually disabled with short hair and indiscriminate taste buds. In 3 different rooms it was impossible to get a good picture on any TV channels (no satellite despite what the phone holding message says), and worse, hot water was virtually unknown. Several times we stood shivering under the shower while the water supply disappeared for 5 - 10 mins. This is a basic for a hotel, and it's shocking that La Reserve can't supply it. Also the fruit juice in the breakfast buffet is noticeably watered-down... the sign of a cheapskate establishment. This hotel was clearly refurbished around 1984, and all the fittings are comically archetypical 80's (black moulded WC and washbasin anyone??). Since not one penny has been spent on the place since, many are also seriously worn and shoddy. One of the power sockets in the room was faulty and positively dangerous. Go to a Travelodge instead - soulless, but at least you're guaranteed the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic option if you're going to Stamford Bridge”
Reviews.Author: StanCFC
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best and cheapest option if you're travelling to see a Chelsea-game at Stamford Bridge. With the great tube/underground/bus-options in London, you'll also get to Oxford Street and Picadilly Circus fairly quickly. While I gave it 5/5, it's not a 5-star hotel. It's a 3-star hotel, but a very nice one. Compared to other 3-star hotels in London, there were a decent amount of space in the room, and there was also a mini-bar. And of course, the room itself was clean and nice, and every time I asked for an extra towel or two, I got it. The continental breakfast you'll get is nothing special, but it was decent enough. And to be honest, all I was looking for was a nice, clean hotel with a good bed and a TV, located near Stamford Bridge, and at a fair price, and that's exactly what I got - plus the mini-bar and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty towers ???”
Reviews.Author: JV123
Reviews.Content: Never judge a book by its cover ? I will in future, from the time I arrived and it took them 25 mins to shuffle the cars around in the small car park to the 20 minutes to check in I knew this was a mistake. It was the key to "one of their best rooms" and couldn't believe my eyes. The wardrobe doors looked like they were about 50 years old and didn;t close, the same goes for the so called "desk" which was very old, looked like a piece of mdf layed on top of a coulple of badly closing cupboard doors. The room was a good size, the beds were comfortable enough but the general cleanliness of the room was "scummy" to say the least! The red 2 seater sofa looked as if it had seen some action (loads of dodgy looking stains), the bathroom smelled like there was a bad drain problem and there was dirt and peeling mastic all over the bathroom furniture, the bathroom was very cramped. The shower was more of a hot and cold "dribble" Overall, the best thing about this place is its location to Earls Court, it could do with some money spent on it to bring it up to a much better standard. The staff were fairly helpful, when you could find one of them. I suppose the only thing missing......was Basil Fawlty !

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, but shoddy hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonKingston
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd read previous reviews before booking. I realised how desparate it all was when I arrived and noticed a 'small hotel' award certificate on the wall of the reception, but dating from 1992 - I don't think the hotel's been cleaned since then. The room was big and quiet, but dirty, the bedspread was covered in very dubious stains. For some reason they leave a complimentary fruit plate (4 granny smiths and 2 oranges) but everything feels so grubby you wouldn't want to try them. Breakfast was awful - continental with no service to speak of, and flies crawling around the danish pastries. Don't stay here, it really is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: ZEROCARBON
Reviews.Content: Booked a room on business for Wed 25th April a good month in advance and receieved confirmation emails etc. However upon arriving at 7.30pmpm (after a long day and 5hours in the car) was told they didnt have a room ready. When I refused to wait around as I had a meeting that evening they eventually found me a very low quality cramped room (dirty carpet) in a near by hotel and I finally magaed to check in around 9.15pm. The following day after my work day I had to return to the Reserve to collect my luggage when they presented me with a full bill. I objected to this but was told I would have to wait for an hour to see the manager as the assitant manager jad no power to alter charges although he offered me a free stay next time !

HotelInfo.Name: La Reserve
HotelInfo.Address: 422-428 Fulham Rd., London SW6 1DU, England
